intro: Impatiens patula, commonly known as the New Guinea impatiens, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a wide range of colors. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 feet, with broad, heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for gardeners. Its foliage and flowers provide ornamental value, and it is often used in landscaping and container gardening.
